resources.string: Leukocoria is an abnormal white reflection from the retina of the eye that is indicative of retinoblastoma and other eye diseases. This app will scan an image of an eye and compare it to data collected from patients in a recent research study. Thanks for checking this app out!
Select an image and crop down to the pupil. For best results, first dilate pupils in a dark room.
First dilate the pupils in a dark room or with a blindfold. Try to crop the photo in so the red box will be in the pupil.
Based on the average colors in the red box, the chance of Leukocoria is very low.
Based on the average colors in the red box, our Leukocoria test is inconclusive.
Based on the average colors in the red box, the chance of Leukocoria is very high.
